column4: My windows partition isn't mounting when I first log into Ubuntu. It use to though. How can I make it so that it does?
you dont have the windows partition in the fstab. add it and reboot. it will mount then
Do i need antying for options?
what is the partition type for your windows partition?
/dev/sda1 /media/Windows ntfs default 0 0 is what i think i need
Oh well it is definetly ntfs.
Do i need to know anything else about it
type fdisk -l as super user and tell the partition showing ntsf
your entry will be some thing like " /dev/sda1  /mnt/sda1  ntfs uid=1000,gid=100 0 0"
you will have to create /mnt/sda1 or have at a place convinient to you
ok. Its so weird Gutsy always did it for me =\
